Detailed Description

template<class DataType>
class DzTSimpleArray< DataType >

A template class which embodies an array style list.

This class is used to store items that do not require calling a copy constructor when copying objects from one memory space to another. Use DzTArray for objects that need to have a copy constructor called.

template<class DataType>
void DzTSimpleArray< DataType >::appendIfUnique ( const DataType  obj  )  [inline]

If the given item is not in the array, it will be appended to the end of the array, otherwise, the array remains unchanged.

template<class DataType>
void DzTSimpleArray< DataType >::clear (  )  [inline]

Removes all items from the list. Actually it just sets the number of items in the list to zero without freeing any space.

template<class DataType>
int DzTSimpleArray< DataType >::find ( const DataType  obj  )  const
Returns:
The index of the object in the array, or -1 if the object is not found in the array. This function works by using the "==" operator to compare objects.

DataType * DzTSimpleArray< DataType >::getValuesUnlocked (  )  const [inline]
Returns:
A pointer to the actual data. Be careful not to alter the size of the returned array of objects. This pointer may not be valid after calls that alter that array.

template<class DataType >
bool DzTSimpleArray< DataType >::setCount ( int  num,
bool  keepExisting = true 
)

Sets the array to be the given size. All existing values that fit within the new array size are guaranteed to remain after this executes if keepExisting is true. Returns false if the new array size is too big and cannot be allocated.
